notes.text:
Use beef mince for cottage pie
Add worcestershire sauce for depth
Freeze individual portions for easy meals

steps.descr: Brown lamb mince, add onion and carrots

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by browning the lamb mince. Add in the diced onion and carrots. You want to hear a nice sizzle and see the meat turn a lovely brown.

steps.instructions: Brown lamb mince, add onion and carrots

steps.descr: Stir in tomato purée and stock, simmer 20 mins

on_enter.say: Now, stir in the tomato purée and lamb stock. We're going to let this simmer for twenty minutes. You'll know it's ready when the sauce thickens and smells absolutely divine.

steps.instructions: Stir in tomato purée and stock, simmer 20 mins

on_enter.say: While the sauce is simmering, let's boil the potatoes until they're tender. You should be able to easily pierce them with a fork.

steps.descr: Mash with butter and milk until smooth

on_enter.say: Now let's mash those potatoes with butter and milk until they're smooth and creamy. This is going to be the lovely topping for our pie.

steps.instructions: Mash with butter and milk until smooth

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Let's transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish. Make sure it's spread out evenly.

steps.descr: Top with mashed potato, fork patterns on top

on_enter.say: Let's top the meat with our mashed potatoes. Use a fork to create some lovely patterns on top. This will help it get nice and crispy.

steps.instructions: Top with mashed potato, fork patterns on top

steps.descr: Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Time to bake our pie. Preheat your oven to two hundred degrees celsius, that's about three hundred ninety-two degrees fahrenheit. Bake it for twenty-five minutes until the top is beautifully golden.

steps.instructions: Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until golden

recipe.title: Shepherd's Pie
recipe.description: Comforting British classic with lamb mince and mashed potato
